intro: Ismene virescens, commonly known as the green ismene, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually lance-shaped. Its flowers are typically white or pale green, with four petals, and it produces small, round fruits that contain one or two seeds. Ismene virescens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
